Detailed Description

Widget that displays presets for file I/O operations, etc.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum DzFileIOPresetWidget::Axis

Enumerations for representing the different axes in the 3D coordinate system. The widget has three axes (lateral, vertical, and depth) which can all be assigned any of these enumerations. If, at any time, an incorrect configuration is set for these axes, the widget will revert to DAZ Studio defaults.

Enumerator:
X_Axis 

Represents the X Axis

Y_Axis 

Represents the Y Axis

Z_Axis 

Represents the Z Axis

INVALID_AXIS 

Represents an invalid axis. This state will rarely, if ever, need to be used.

enum DzFileIOPresetWidget::ConversionType

The types of Conversion available for this widget

Enumerator:
Import 

This widget will be used for importing into DAZ Studio

Export 

This widget will be used for exporting from DAZ Studio

bool  includeName = false 
) const

Sets/Updates settings to contain common and type specific default settings for the current preset This is equivalent to calling getSpecificDefaults() and then getCommonDefault().

Parameters:

includeName If true, a "Preset" setting will be included with the name of the current preset

void DzFileIOPresetWidget::getSettingsFromInterface ( DzFileIOSettings *  settings  )  const [protected, virtual]

Sets/Updates values for settings based on the current state of this widget. The default implementation does nothing. Re-implement this method when sub-classing if additional widgets are added to the interface

Parameters:
settings The settings object to which values will be set.
void DzFileIOPresetWidget::getSpecificDefaults ( DzFileIOSettings *  settings,
bool  includeName = false 
) const [virtual]

Sets/Updates values for settings to the current default values, specific to this object's preset type. The default implementation uses the DzFileIOPresetMgr to get the default settings. Re-implement this method when sub-classing if additional widgets are added to the interface.

Parameters:
settings The settings object to which values will be set.
includeName If true, a "Preset" setting will be included with the name of the current preset

bool DzFileIOPresetWidget::removeUserPreset ( const QString &  presetName  )  [slot]

Attempts to remove the preset with name presetName

Parameters:
presetName The name of the preset to remove
Returns:
true if the remove was successful or if the preset did not exist, false if it is not a user defined preset
bool DzFileIOPresetWidget::removeUserPreset ( int  id  )  [slot]

Attempts to remove the preset with the given id

Parameters:
id The id of the preset to remove
Returns:
true if the remove was successful, false if the preset does not exist or is not a user preset
bool DzFileIOPresetWidget::saveUserPreset ( const QString &  presetName,
bool  keepCommonSettings,
bool  keepSpecificSettings,
bool  makeActive = true 
) [slot]

Attempts to save the current setting to a new preset named presetName.

Parameters:
presetName The name of the new preset
keepCommonSettings If false and common settings for a preset with presetName already exist, they will be changed to match the common settings of the current preset
keepSpecificSettings If a preset named already exists, this setting determines whether the specific settings should be overwritten or not.
makeActive If true and the save is successful, the active preset will become the newly created preset. If false or the save is unsuccessful, the current preset will remain unchanged
Returns:
true if the save was successful, false if a preset of the same name already exists and has settings for the sub-class calling this method
void DzFileIOPresetWidget::setConversionType ( DzFileIOPresetWidget::ConversionType  type  ) 

Sets the conversion type of this widget to type

Parameters:
type Whether this widget is being used for Import or Export
void DzFileIOPresetWidget::setExportTitle ( const QString &  title  ) 

Sets the title for when this widget is used for exporting purposes

Parameters:
title The title to display for this widget
void DzFileIOPresetWidget::setImportTitle ( const QString &  title  ) 

Sets the title for when this widget is used for importing purposes

Parameters:
title The title to display for this widget
void DzFileIOPresetWidget::setSettings ( const DzFileIOSettings *  options  ) 

Sets the settings for this widget based on options. If the "Preset" key is used and is a valid preset then all other settings will be ignored. If it is not present or is not a valid preset then the active preset will switch to custom and all keys in options will be used.

Parameters:
options The options to set for this widget
void DzFileIOPresetWidget::setShowIndividualSettings ( bool  show  ) 

Sets whether individual settings are shown or hidden.

Parameters:
show If true, the individual settings will be shown, otherwise they will be hidden
bool DzFileIOPresetWidget::showIndividualSettings (  )  const
Returns:
true if individual settings are shown, otherwise false
void DzFileIOPresetWidget::showInterface ( bool  show  )  [protected, virtual, slot]

Shows/Hides the interface. Sub-classes should reimplement this method if the default implementation is not satisfactory.

Parameters:
show Whether to show or hide the interface
void DzFileIOPresetWidget::updateInterface ( DzFileIOSettings *  settings,
bool  blockSigs 
) [protected, virtual]

Sets/Updates the interface of this widget based on the values in settings. For proper interface behavior, each component of the interface should only be updated if the interface represents a different value than that in the settings object. The default implementation does nothing. Re-implement this method when sub-classing if additional widgets are added to the interface.

Parameters:
settings The settings object to which values will be set.
blockSignals Whether or not signals should be blocked when making changes to the interface.
bool DzFileIOPresetWidget::usePreset ( int  id  )  [slot]

Attempts to change the active preset to the preset with identifier id

Parameters:
id The id of the preset to change to
Returns:
true if the preset was changed, false otherwise
bool DzFileIOPresetWidget::usePreset ( const QString &  presetName  )  [slot]

Attempts to change the active preset to the preset named presetName

Parameters:
presetName The name of the preset to change to
Returns:
true if the preset was changed, false otherwise
void DzFileIOPresetWidget::userChangedPresetOptions (  )  [protected, slot]

This slot should be called whenever the user changes settings to a preset. It should be called only after the current settings for this object have been changed. These settings are stored as the new settings for the Custom preset and the active preset is changed to the Custom preset.
